title: About Me
text:
Hi! I am Yin Shuen, a Year 2 Communications and New Media student. In my spare time, I enjoy watching movies, checking out new food places and listening to songs on Spotify.
The wide variety of song genres and artists available on streaming platform Spotify provides me with many options when it comes to song choices. This makes me interested in diving deeper in data insights regarding the song offerings in Spotify.



One of my favourite cafes!

title: My Project
text: In my project, I will be analysing a dataset containing information of the top tracks in Spotify between the year 2000 to 2019. This dataset was taken from Kaggle, a free dataset sharing platform.

title: My Project
text: In my project, I will be analysing a dataset containing information of the top tracks in Spotify between the year 2000 to 2019. This dataset was taken from Kaggle, a free dataset sharing platform.

title: My Project
text:
Introduction: An overview of Spotify
Spotify is a digital music, podcast, and video service that provides access to songs and other content from many creators globally (What Is Spotify?, n.d.). It is the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with more than 602 million users, including 236 million subscribers in more than 180 markets (Spotify — about Spotify, n.d.).

title: My Project
text: In my project, I will be analysing a dataset containing information of the top tracks in Spotify between the year 2000 to 2019. This dataset was taken from Kaggle, a free dataset sharing platform.

title: My Project
text:
Why this dataset?
I have been an avid and frequent user of Spotify for quite some time. Over the years, I have developed an interest and habit of listening to top tracks within the streaming platform. Thus, I am keen to analyse the different aspects of top song hits through more in-depth data insights.
This dataset is a csv file that contains audio statistics of the top 2000 tracks on Spotify from 2000-2019. The data contains about 18 columns each describing the track and its qualities.

title: My Project
text:
Introduction: An overview of Spotify
Spotify is a digital music, podcast, and video service that provides access to songs and other content from many creators globally (What Is Spotify?, n.d.). It is the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with more than 602 million users, including 236 million subscribers in more than 180 markets (Spotify — about Spotify, n.d.).

title: My Project
text:
Why this dataset?
I have been an avid and frequent user of Spotify for quite some time. Over the years, I have developed an interest and habit of listening to top tracks within the streaming platform. Thus, I am keen to analyse the different aspects of top song hits through more in-depth data insights.
This dataset is a csv file that contains audio statistics of the top 2000 tracks on Spotify from 2000-2019. The data contains about 18 columns each describing the track and its qualities.

title: Data Story
text:
I have cleaned the dataset by removing duplicate and NA values, as well as selecting only the relevant columns required for my data analysis.
You can view both original and cleaned datasets here:

#App1
 
The column “genre” lists the genres of each song, with one song having possibly more than one genre. This makes it hard for analysis when using the “genre” column.

title: Data Story
text:
4. Songs Per Artist - Top 50 Artists
The bar chart below consolidates data on the number of songs released by the top 50 artists featured in the dataset of top Spotify tracks, arranged from highest number of songs to lowest.
The artist with the most number of featured songs is Rihanna, with 25 songs.

title: Data Story
text:
5. Top 25 Songs Based On Popularity
Line graph features the top 25 songs from the dataset, arranged in descending order based on popularity level.
The most popular song is Sweater Weather, with a popularity rating of 89 out of 100.

title: Data Story
text:
6. Songs Containing Explicit Content
This simple pie chart below clearly illustrates the percentage of songs which contain explicit content.
72.4% , or the majority of the songs in this dataset, are explicit.

title: Data Story
text:
7. Year vs Explicit Content
The area plot below illustrates the relationship between the year of song published and explicit songs.

title: Data Story
text:
8. Popularity versus Explicit Songs
The bar plot below visualises the popularity of songs based on whether they are explicit or not.
